item.description:
Our Southern NH 9.12 group is holding an easy to understand seminar on the Monetary and Banking policies of the US.  The seminar will be divided into four one hour classes on each Wednesday in October, beginning on October 5th.  I believe the information in this seminar is critical for people to learn -- and it will encourage them to become more involved with helping solve the problems of our country. 

The instructors will be Representative Donna Mauro and Brad Winslow.  Both have extensive knowledge of Austrian economics and the history of the Federal Reserve. Here are the details:


What is Money (and How it Affects You!)



The Southern NH 9.12 Project will hold a series of four informative classes that will: 


 • Discuss basic and advanced concepts of our monetary system • Explain the role of the Federal Reserve Bank • Focus on the monetary policies of the United States  • Discuss how these policies affect the standard of living and liberty of all Americans

• Provide reference information and web links for your personal research


This educational series is intended for anyone (including young people) interested in learning more about the U.S. banking and monetary system and its impact on the United States and world economies.





This seminar will be taught by two experts in the field of Austrian Economics, Representative Donna Mauro and Brad Winslow.  It is free and open to the public, and will be held at the Windham Public Library from 7PM to 8PM on each Wednesday in October, beginning October 5th.
item.name: U.S. Monetary and Banking Seminar
